featuredJobs.title: Java Spring Boot Microservices Developer
featuredJobs.shortDescription: Design and develop microservices using Java Spring Boot, work with cloud-native technologies.
featuredJobs.fullDescription:
We are seeking an experienced Java Spring Boot Developer to join our dynamic team. You will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining microservices-based applications using Java Spring Boot framework. The ideal candidate will have strong experience in building scalable, high-performance applications and working with cloud-native technologies.

Key Responsibilities:
• Design and develop microservices using Java Spring Boot
• Implement RESTful APIs and integrate with various systems
• Work with containerization technologies like Docker and Kubernetes
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver high-quality solutions
• Participate in code reviews and maintain coding standards
• Troubleshoot and optimize application performance
• Work with CI/CD pipelines and DevOps practices

Required Skills:
• 5+ years of experience in Java development
• Strong expertise in Spring Boot, Spring Framework
• Experience with microservices architecture
• Knowledge of RESTful API design and development
• Familiarity with Docker and Kubernetes
• Experience with databases (SQL and NoSQL)
• Understanding of cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, or GCP)
• Knowledge of version control systems (Git)

Preferred Qualifications:
• Experience with Apache Kafka for event streaming
• Knowledge of monitoring tools like Prometheus, Grafana
• Familiarity with CI/CD tools like Jenkins, GitLab CI
• Experience with testing frameworks (JUnit, Mockito)
• Understanding of security best practices
• Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field

featuredJobs.title: BSS/OSS Telecom Consultant
featuredJobs.shortDescription: Lead telecom BSS/OSS implementations, Oracle BRM, OSM, UIM expertise required.
featuredJobs.fullDescription:
Join our telecom consulting team as a BSS/OSS Specialist where you'll lead complex telecom transformation projects. You'll work with cutting-edge Oracle telecom solutions and help major telecom operators modernize their billing and operational support systems.

Key Responsibilities:
• Lead BSS/OSS implementation projects for telecom clients
• Configure and customize Oracle BRM (Billing and Revenue Management)
• Implement Oracle OSM (Order and Service Management) solutions
• Design and deploy Oracle UIM (User Interaction Management) portals
• Analyze business requirements and translate them into technical solutions
• Provide technical leadership and mentoring to junior team members
• Collaborate with client stakeholders and manage project deliverables
• Ensure compliance with telecom industry standards and regulations

Required Skills:
• 6+ years of experience in telecom BSS/OSS domain
• Strong expertise in Oracle BRM configuration and customization
• Experience with Oracle OSM implementation and workflows
• Knowledge of Oracle UIM portal development
• Understanding of telecom business processes (billing, provisioning, etc.)
• Experience with Oracle database and PL/SQL
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
• Excellent communication and client-facing skills

Preferred Qualifications:
• Oracle BRM certification
• Experience with telecom protocols (RADIUS, Diameter)
• Knowledge of cloud-native telecom solutions
• Experience with agile methodologies
• Understanding of 5G and next-generation telecom technologies
• Bachelor's degree in Engineering or related field

featuredJobs.title: API Management Specialist (APIGEE/3Scale)
featuredJobs.shortDescription: Implement and manage API gateways, developer portals, and API lifecycle management.
featuredJobs.fullDescription:
We're looking for an API Management Specialist to join our integration team. You'll be responsible for designing, implementing, and managing enterprise API ecosystems using leading API management platforms like APIGEE and Red Hat 3Scale.

Key Responsibilities:
• Design and implement API management solutions using APIGEE and Red Hat 3Scale
• Develop API policies for security, throttling, and transformation
• Create and maintain developer portals and API documentation
• Implement OAuth 2.0, JWT, and other authentication mechanisms
• Monitor API performance and troubleshoot issues
• Work with development teams to onboard APIs to the gateway
• Establish API governance and best practices
• Provide technical guidance on API design and architecture

Required Skills:
• 4+ years of experience in API management
• Strong expertise in Google APIGEE or Red Hat 3Scale
• Experience with API design and RESTful services
• Knowledge of OAuth 2.0, JWT, and API security
• Understanding of API lifecycle management
• Experience with JSON, XML, and data transformation
• Familiarity with scripting languages (JavaScript, Python)
• Strong troubleshooting and problem-solving skills

Preferred Qualifications:
• APIGEE certification
• Experience with OpenAPI/Swagger specifications
• Knowledge of microservices architecture
• Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP)
• Understanding of DevOps practices and CI/CD
• Experience with monitoring tools (Splunk, ELK stack)
• Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field

allJobs.title: DevOps Engineer (Kubernetes/OpenShift)
allJobs.shortDescription: Manage container orchestration, CI/CD pipelines, and cloud infrastructure.
allJobs.fullDescription:
Join our DevOps team to help organizations accelerate their software delivery through modern DevOps practices. You'll work with cutting-edge technologies like Kubernetes, OpenShift, and cloud platforms to build robust, scalable infrastructure solutions.

Key Responsibilities:
• Design and manage Kubernetes and OpenShift clusters
• Build and maintain CI/CD pipelines using Jenkins, GitLab CI, or similar tools
• Implement Infrastructure as Code using Terraform, Ansible
• Monitor application and infrastructure performance
• Automate deployment processes and system configurations
• Collaborate with development teams to optimize application delivery
• Implement security best practices and compliance requirements
• Troubleshoot production issues and implement solutions

Required Skills:
• 4+ years of experience in DevOps or Site Reliability Engineering
• Strong expertise in Kubernetes and container orchestration
• Experience with OpenShift platform
• Proficiency in CI/CD tools (Jenkins, GitLab CI, Azure DevOps)
• Knowledge of Infrastructure as Code (Terraform, Ansible)
• Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP)
• Strong scripting skills (Bash, Python, PowerShell)
• Understanding of monitoring and logging tools

Preferred Qualifications:
• Kubernetes certification (CKA, CKAD)
• Experience with service mesh technologies (Istio, Linkerd)
• Knowledge of security scanning and compliance tools
• Experience with GitOps practices (ArgoCD, Flux)
• Understanding of database administration
• Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field

allJobs.title: Oracle Integration Cloud Consultant
allJobs.shortDescription: Design and implement Oracle Integration Cloud solutions for enterprise clients.
allJobs.fullDescription:
We're seeking an experienced Oracle Integration Cloud (OIC) Consultant to join our enterprise solutions team. You'll work on complex integration projects, helping clients modernize their enterprise architecture with Oracle's cloud-based integration platform.

Key Responsibilities:
• Design and implement Oracle Integration Cloud (OIC) solutions
• Develop integration flows using OIC adapters and connectors
• Configure and customize Oracle SOA Suite components
• Implement B2B integrations and EDI solutions
• Work with Oracle Cloud Applications (Fusion, HCM, ERP)
• Provide technical leadership on integration architecture
• Collaborate with functional consultants and client stakeholders
• Perform system testing and support go-live activities

Required Skills:
• 5+ years of experience in Oracle integration technologies
• Strong expertise in Oracle Integration Cloud (OIC)
• Experience with Oracle SOA Suite and Service Bus
• Knowledge of Oracle Fusion Middleware
• Understanding of web services (SOAP, REST)
• Experience with Oracle Database and PL/SQL
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
• Excellent communication and client-facing abilities

Preferred Qualifications:
• Oracle Cloud certification
• Experience with Oracle Cloud Applications
• Knowledge of B2B and EDI standards
• Understanding of enterprise architecture patterns
• Experience with Oracle Process Cloud Service (PCS)
• Familiarity with Oracle Visual Builder Cloud Service
• Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or Engineering

allJobs.title: Data Science/AI-ML Engineer
allJobs.shortDescription: Develop AI/ML models, implement MLOps pipelines, and create data-driven solutions.
allJobs.fullDescription:
Join our Data Science team to build cutting-edge AI/ML solutions that drive business value for our clients. You'll work on diverse projects ranging from predictive analytics to computer vision and natural language processing.

Key Responsibilities:
• Develop and deploy machine learning models for various business use cases
• Implement MLOps pipelines for model training, validation, and deployment
• Work with large datasets to extract insights and build predictive models
• Collaborate with data engineers to build robust data pipelines
• Create data visualizations and reports for stakeholders
• Research and implement state-of-the-art ML algorithms
• Optimize model performance and scalability
• Document methodologies and maintain model governance

Required Skills:
• 3+ years of experience in data science or machine learning
• Strong proficiency in Python and ML libraries (scikit-learn, pandas, numpy)
• Experience with deep learning frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch)
• Knowledge of statistical analysis and data mining techniques
• Experience with data visualization tools (Matplotlib, Seaborn, Plotly)
• Understanding of MLOps practices and tools
• Experience with cloud ML services (AWS SageMaker, Azure ML, GCP AI)
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills

Preferred Qualifications:
• Advanced degree in Data Science, Statistics, or related field
• Experience with big data technologies (Spark, Hadoop)
• Knowledge of computer vision or NLP techniques
• Experience with model deployment and monitoring
• Familiarity with containerization (Docker, Kubernetes)
• Understanding of A/B testing and experimental design
• Experience with version control and collaborative development

allJobs.title: Full Stack Developer (Java/.NET)
allJobs.shortDescription: Develop end-to-end applications using Java/.NET, Angular, React technologies.
allJobs.fullDescription:
We're looking for a versatile Full Stack Developer to join our development team. You'll work on diverse projects, building both frontend and backend components using modern technologies and frameworks.

Key Responsibilities:
• Develop full-stack web applications using Java/.NET backend technologies
• Build responsive frontend interfaces using React, Angular, or Vue.js
• Design and implement RESTful APIs and microservices
• Work with databases (SQL Server, PostgreSQL, MongoDB)
• Implement authentication and authorization mechanisms
• Collaborate with UX/UI designers to implement user interfaces
• Write unit tests and participate in code reviews
• Deploy applications to cloud platforms

Required Skills:
• 3+ years of full-stack development experience
• Strong proficiency in Java or .NET framework
• Experience with frontend frameworks (React, Angular, Vue.js)
• Knowledge of HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript/TypeScript
• Experience with relational and NoSQL databases
• Understanding of version control systems (Git)
• Knowledge of web security best practices
• Experience with agile development methodologies

Preferred Qualifications:
• Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure)
• Knowledge of containerization (Docker)
• Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines
• Experience with testing frameworks
• Understanding of microservices architecture
• Knowledge of message queues (RabbitMQ, Kafka)
• Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field

allJobs.title: Cloud Solutions Architect (AWS/Azure)
allJobs.shortDescription: Design cloud architectures, lead migration projects, and optimize cloud costs.
allJobs.fullDescription:
We're seeking a senior Cloud Solutions Architect to lead our cloud transformation initiatives. You'll design scalable, secure, and cost-effective cloud architectures for enterprise clients across various industries.

Key Responsibilities:
• Design end-to-end cloud architectures for enterprise applications
• Lead cloud migration projects from planning to execution
• Develop cloud adoption strategies and roadmaps
• Optimize cloud costs and resource utilization
• Implement cloud security best practices and compliance frameworks
• Mentor development teams on cloud-native development
• Conduct architecture reviews and provide technical guidance
• Stay updated with latest cloud services and technologies

Required Skills:
• 6+ years of experience in cloud architecture and design
• Strong expertise in AWS and/or Microsoft Azure
• Experience with cloud migration strategies and tools
• Knowledge of containerization and orchestration (Docker, Kubernetes)
• Understanding of networking, security, and compliance in cloud
• Experience with Infrastructure as Code (Terraform, CloudFormation)
• Strong communication and presentation skills
• Experience with enterprise architecture frameworks

Preferred Qualifications:
• AWS Solutions Architect or Azure Architect certification
• Experience with multi-cloud environments
• Knowledge of serverless computing and event-driven architectures
• Experience with cost optimization and FinOps practices
• Understanding of DevOps and CI/CD practices
• Experience with enterprise integration patterns
• Master's degree in Computer Science or related field
